SENT.plain: This report describes a young woman with ulcerative colitis who developed rapidly fatal pneumococcal septicaemia
This case supports the hypothesis that splenic atrophy might contribute to the morbidity of ulcerative colitis
The occurrence of splenic atrophy in ulcerative colitis is now well established
Splenic atrophy from other causes has been associated with severe bacterial infections, often pneumococcal
It has been suggested that splenic atrophy is most severe when ulcerative colitis is active and may contribute to postoperative morbidity
This case documents overwhelming septicaemia in a patient with splenic atrophy whose colitis was in remission
